name: nytimes
text:
Masks are to be “required at all times” and “without exception” in the U.S. House of Representatives, Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced on Tuesday. The announcement strengthened an existing mask requirement, which did not apply to people who were speaking.
https://t.co/RmYJBrewDN

name: nytimes
text: Attorney General William Barr’s resignation makes Jeffrey Rosen, his low-profile deputy, the nation’s top law enforcement official for President Trump’s last month. https://t.co/1U57t1PzDy

name: nytimes
text:
If the U.S. wants to cut its greenhouse gas emissions to zero by 2050 — a goal endorsed by President-elect Joe Biden — the country will need to build a staggering amount of new energy infrastructure in the next 10 years.
https://t.co/UNQ5AsK2zw

name: nytimes
text:
A two-word phrase that has charmed children for generations — "snow day" — could soon disappear from New York City students' vocabulary as a result of the pandemic-driven shift to online learning.
https://t.co/ctzxmEHt0Q

name: nytimes
text: News Analysis: President-elect Joe Biden has a limited but contentious personal history with the Russian president. But to achieve his foreign policy goals, Biden has to find ways to collaborate with a leader who is nakedly hostile to Western interests. https://t.co/4dCGi75zUT

name: nytimes
text:
Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Tuesday congratulated President-elect Joe Biden on his victory, breaking with President Trump in an effort end the Republican party’s attempts to sow doubt about the election.
https://t.co/03AvOrIR8D

name: nytimes
text:
Washington, D.C. passed a law on Tuesday that would give people who committed crimes as young adults a chance to have their sentences reduced. The legislation would apply to those under 25 when they committed a crime who have served at least 15 years.
https://t.co/2tW6Fc9A3T

name: nytimes
text:
While the U.S. Constitution gives Congress the final say in the election, there is no chance that it will agree to overturn the results and keep President Trump in office.
https://t.co/Xk9Av0gVio

name: nytimes
text: After months of unrest over racial injustice across the U.S., many college students, stuck studying from home, have found it harder to talk through difficult issues with their peers and professors. https://t.co/m0yNUEfavD https://t.co/E4qCQg6MAn

name: nytimes
text:
Hospitals around the U.S. scrambled to administer the first shots after waiting months for the coronavirus vaccine, with some deliberately spotlighting the moment as others left the specifics of who would go first more to chance.
https://t.co/x6gQH2vRlz

name: nytimes
text:
A husband and wife who dressed up as Santa and Mrs. Claus for an annual Christmas parade and tree-lighting ceremony in Georgia learned three days after the events that they had the coronavirus, officials said.
https://t.co/mmlKGdrEwI

name: nytimes
text:
President-elect Joe Biden on Tuesday urged Georgia voters to cast ballots for two Democratic Senate candidates in a pair of critical runoffs early next month that could give his party control of the Senate.
https://t.co/he5kCI8iRB

name: nytimes
text:
Special trains operated by India's government earlier this year were meant to get migrant workers home safely during a lockdown. Instead, the trains helped spread the coronavirus across the country.

“It felt like doomsday,” one ticket collector said.
https://t.co/1JM97vjbPv

name: nytimes
text:
Congressional leaders scrambled on Tuesday to reach agreement on a pandemic relief bill and a government spending bill ahead of a Friday deadline, but a final deal remained elusive.
https://t.co/xt3AMB90oF

name: nytimes
text:
MacKenzie Scott announced on Tuesday that she had given nearly $4.2 billion to 384 organizations in just the last four months. Many of the groups are focused on basic needs, including food banks and Meals on Wheels, in a trying year for millions of people.
https://t.co/qT4FwSal6q

name: nytimes
text:
Lawmakers in Mexico approved legislation Tuesday that could sharply limit cooperation with U.S. drug agents. The move came after weeks of tension over the Americans’ short-lived arrest of a former Mexican official.
https://t.co/F4ivm5HG0w

name: nytimes
text:
Delivery workers in South Korea say they feel lucky to have jobs amid growing unemployment. But they are also paying a price, as a string of deaths among couriers this year has caused a national uproar.
https://t.co/e3QKGNJNEW

name: nytimes
text:
RT @suhasiniraj: The Virus Trains: How Lockdown Chaos Spread Covid-19 Across India

PM Modi’s coronavirus restrictions sent migrant workers fleeing. To get them home, the government offered special trains. But the trains would spread the virus across the country. Our story https://t.co/StpW5WGFPA

name: nytimes
text: Here's a look at some of the highlights worth watching from late-night TV. https://t.co/rqXn35k1dB

name: nytimes
text: Sweden has been an outlier in the global pandemic: It eschewed lockdowns and kept restaurants, bars, schools, movie theaters and gyms mostly open. But the second wave is forcing authorities to reconsider their approach. https://t.co/2mc3m1SSt3

name: nytimes
text:
A man was sentenced to four weeks in jail for defying coronavirus restrictions after he drove a jet ski from Scotland to the Isle of Man to see his girlfriend. 

He thought the journey would take 40 minutes – it took four and a half hours. https://t.co/gsdIjQKUUs

name: nytimes
text: Japanese prosecutors charged a man with arson and murder in connection with a fire last year that killed 36 at an animation studio in Kyoto, the country’s deadliest attack in decades. https://t.co/CsHgewxMK2

name: nytimes
text:
President-elect Joe Biden intends to name Gina McCarthy, a former E.P.A. chief, as his senior adviser on climate change, and Jennifer Granholm, a former Michigan governor, to lead the Department of Energy.
https://t.co/XKGDAqa4zO

name: nytimes
text:
President-elect Joe Biden will nominate Pete Buttigieg to be secretary of transportation, a role that is expected to be newly climate-centric. Buttigieg would bring a younger voice to the cabinet and add to its diversity as its first openly gay member.
https://t.co/wBf1EmSLwS

name: nytimes
text:
Tom Cruise erupted at crew members on the set of “Mission: Impossible 7” over breaking Covid-19 protocols.

“If you don’t do it, you’re fired!”" the actor can be heard saying in a expletive-laden audio clip. https://t.co/SJ7CkizmpQ

name: nytimes
text: A major winter storm is expected to sweep through parts of the Mid-Atlantic and the Northeast starting today, bringing heavy snow, freezing rain and strong winds. Follow live updates here. https://t.co/ZDFpdHxovM

text: Foreign hackers have once again infiltrated U.S. government computer networks. Who was behind the latest breach, and how does this keep happening? Listen to today’s episode of The Daily. https://t.co/yLHaq0unxC
